title: Length and Measurement Learning Using Google Maps for Students with Mild Intellectual Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic length units (m, cm) and ability to interpret simple maps
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment applying Model-Evoked Activities (MEA) for real-life problem-solving in smartphone-based constrained technology settings

learning_goals: Using real-life map examples, learners can measure distances within 5 meters with 10 cm unit accuracy.
Learners can calculate virtual route lengths with 80% accuracy using Google Maps' distance measurement feature.
Based on distance data measured through collaborative activities, learners can write simple comparative explanations.
